TITLE.P: Framework agreements for the purchase of consulting engineer services.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The objective of the procurement is to connect with consulting engineers who shall be able to cover the Contracting Authority’s need for technical consultancy services to planning and implementation of investment and maintenance projects for the Contracting Authority.

The objective of the procurement is to connect with consulting engineers who shall be able to cover the Contracting Authority’s need for technical consultancy services to planning and implementation of investment and maintenance projects for the Contracting Authority.

SUITABILITY.P: Requirement: Tenderers shall have their tax, employer contribution and VAT payments in order. Documentation requirement: Tax and VAT certificate. The certificate shall not be more than 6 months from the deadline for receipt of tenders. The certificate can be obtained electronically from Altinn. For further information, see Skatteetaten.no. Foreign tenderers: Foreign tenderers must submit equivalent certificates from their own country that demonstrate that they their tax and duty payments in order. If the authorities in the relevant country do not issue such certificates, the tenderer shall submit a statement which verifies that all taxes and duties have been paid. The declaration shall be approved and signed by the tenderer's Financial Director/person responsible for Finance.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Tenderers shall have sufficient economic capacity to fulfil the contract.
A solidity assessment from an approved credit appraisal agency. The assessment shall be based on the most recent known accounting figures.

The key figures in the accounts must be presented together with an assessment of the tenderer's payment history, or annual accounts for the last two years. These must contain notes, the board's report and auditor's report.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: 1. Requirement:
The tenderer should have at their disposal sufficient capacity and competence to provide the services being requested.
Documentation requirement: a description of the number of qualified personnel the tenderer has at their disposal for fulfilment of the contract.
The tenderer must confirm that he has a minimum one extra senior resource of equivalent competence and experience in addition to dedicated resources, cf. Point 9 in the tender documentation.
2. Requirement:
Experience from similar assignments is required — Reference Projects.
The tenderer shall have good experience from the execution of equivalent deliveries/comparable assignments in each discipline. Relevant assignments are for example:
— Schools/Nursery Schools,
— Nursing homes,
— Sports Halls,
— Buildings and associated infrastructure or equivalent municipal property.
Tenderers shall be able to demonstrate experience in the use of BIM, but does not need experience with this in all disciplines in order to be qualified.
Documentation requirement:
A list with an overview and description of the tenderer's 1 to 3 most relevant assignments during the last 3 years for each discipline.
The list/description shall as a minimum contain:
— name of customer/recipient,
— scope of the assignment,
— description of the business' role,
— the assignment's value,
— date of the assignment,
— a brief description of the delivery.
It is the tenderer's responsibility to document relevance through the description.
The enclosed template for references shall be used. See Part I, Annex 5.
The same reference can be provided for several disciplines if the tenderer can demonstrate relevant participation.
3. Requirement:
— quality assurance,
— the company shall have systems for quality management,
Documentation requirement:
The documentation shall be provided in one of the following ways:

— Alternative 1: description of the company's procedures regarding quality management, with emphasis on quality assurance, resource management, management responsibility and continuous analysis and improvement.
— Alternative 2: if a tenderer holds ISO 9001:2000 certification or the equivalent, this can be enclosed.
4. Requirement:
Technical qualifications:
The tenderer shall have qualifications equivalent to requirements for central certification for enterprise Classification 2 in the following certification disciplines:
“applicant” and “engineering designer” for disciplines for which qualification is sought.
Documentation requirement:
The documentation shall be provided in one of the following ways:
— Alternative 1: documentation of central certification in enterprise Classification 2 for the relevant disciplines,

— Alternative 2: alternative documentation showing the tenderer's required and relevant professional qualifications for implementing measures as an “engineering designer and applicant”; in enterprise Classification 2 for the relevant disciplines.
5. Requirement:
Describe procedures for professional updating:

The tenderer shall have procedures for updating of competence of their specialist personnel in for example building technical regulations. Norwegian Standard’s enterprise contracts and relevant industry standards.
Documentation requirement:
The tenderer is requested to give a brief description of procedures for professional updating and skill upgrading.
